item.description: #NBALeaguePass at â‚±499 per month is expensive considering that that because of the timezone difference I might just be able to watch 4x in a month, usually during weekends only. â‚±199 per game is crazy stupid! #NBA should know better.

item.title: @deuts.hamili.net 3lesw62kwvk25
item.description: Any Docker app that insists on #Docker volumes and not support volume binds will be a no go moving forward. I’m looking at you #SearXNG, #Grafana, and #Prometheus.
item.content:encoded: Any Docker app that insists on #Docker volumes and not support volume binds will be a no go moving forward. I’m looking at you #SearXNG, #Grafana, and #Prometheus.

item.title: @deuts.hamili.net 3lesvj73d3k25
item.description: Dealing with Docker volumes is just a pain - restoring always comes with annoying permission issues. I much prefer using volume binds for persistence â€“ full control over the file system, no guesswork on data location, and backups are a breeze. Anyone else feel the same? #Docker #DevOps #Containers
item.content:encoded: Dealing with Docker volumes is just a pain - restoring always comes with annoying permission issues. I much prefer using volume binds for persistence â€“ full control over the file system, no guesswork on data location, and backups are a breeze. Anyone else feel the same? #Docker #DevOps #Containers

item.title: @deuts.hamili.net 3lesjdhn6as25
item.description:
My wishlist for #OpenGist:

  1. Ability to add custom metadata
  2. Home should point to All (existing) gists, not new gist
  3. Better search, include description, url and any custom metadata in the search parameters and results. github.com/âˆž
item.content:encoded:
My wishlist for #OpenGist:

  1. Ability to add custom metadata
  2. Home should point to All (existing) gists, not new gist
  3. Better search, include description, url and any custom metadata in the search parameters and results. github.com/âˆž

item.title: @deuts.hamili.net 3lepzmm5jgc23
item.description: Is it just me? I find so much insight from running docker stats regularly via cron, logging them, and data modeling and analyzing via #PowerQuery and #PowerPivot #DAX compared to what I have with the #Prometheus, #Grafana, CAdvisor, and Node-Exporter. The latter further consumes system resources.
item.content:encoded: Is it just me? I find so much insight from running docker stats regularly via cron, logging them, and data modeling and analyzing via #PowerQuery and #PowerPivot #DAX compared to what I have with the #Prometheus, #Grafana, CAdvisor, and Node-Exporter. The latter further consumes system resources.
